attributes.action: Hold a UK wide review of litter policy & policing to make the UK a cleaner place
attributes.additional_details:
Litter has been well documented in the media recently but is a systemic issue faced by us all that ignores government boundaries. 

Challenging the acceptance of litter & reducing the litter on our streets will make all nations of the UK cleaner & better place to lives. 

Better educating & empowering young people will be a key part of tackling this problem, which should start at the youngest age possible. 

Exploring the empowerment of communities & economic opportunities will also be key.
attributes.background: We need a different approach to tackle litter in our communities. We would like all UK administrations to collaborate to collectively review litter policy - this includes education, community empowerment, funding, policing and enforcement to better solve this national problem.

rejection.details:
The issue of litter policy is the responsibility of local authorities and devolved administrations not the UK Government. You could start a petition calling for a Government review into tackling littering in England, if that's what you'd like to see happen. 

You might like to sign this petition we currently have open on this topic
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566467
